security_audit.summary: Documentation skill containing Claude API code examples from official Anthropic cookbooks. The only code file (scripts/memory_tool.py) implements a secure memory handler with strict path validation, confined filesystem access, no network calls, and no external command execution.

content.user_title: Learn Claude API with code examples
content.value_statement: Building AI applications with Claude requires knowing API patterns and best practices. This skill provides 50+ copy-pasteable code examples for classification, RAG, tool use, vision, and agent workflows from the official Anthropic cookbooks.
actual_capabilities: 50+ code examples for Claude API integration
Tool use and function calling patterns
limitations: Reference material only, does not execute code
Python-focused but concepts apply to other languages
Does not include actual Jupyter notebooks

use_cases.title: Learn Claude API basics
use_cases.description: Start with basic message creation and progress through structured examples.

use_cases.title: Build AI-powered apps
use_cases.description: Integrate Claude with tools, databases, and external services.

use_cases.title: Implement advanced patterns
use_cases.description: Use RAG, agents, and prompt caching for production systems.

prompt_templates.title: API basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a Claude client and send my first message with the Anthropic Python SDK.

prompt_templates.title: Tool integration
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I define tools for Claude to call? Give me an example with a weather lookup function.

prompt_templates.title: RAG setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up RAG with Claude using a vector database like Pinecone for semantic search.

prompt_templates.title: Agent workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to build an orchestrator-subagent pattern with Claude for complex workflows.

output_examples.input: How do I implement tool use with Claude?
output: Define tools with name, description, and input schema
Pass tools array to messages.create() call
Submit tool results back to continue conversation

best_practices: Use environment variables for API keys (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)
Implement retry logic with exponential backoff for reliability
Validate tool inputs and handle errors gracefully
Cache large system prompts to reduce costs and latency
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in source code
Skipping error handling for API calls
Using outdated model names without checking current versions
Ignoring token limits causing truncated responses

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: Python examples are primary. Concepts transfer to any language with Claude API SDK support.

faq.question: How many examples are included?
faq.answer: 50+ practical code examples covering classification, RAG, tools, vision, and agents.

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: Yes. Get your key from anthropic.com to run the example code.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: These are reference examples. Your data only goes to Anthropic API when you implement them.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: Implement retry logic with backoff. Check your account limits and consider prompt caching.

faq.question: How is this different from documentation?
faq.answer: Cookbooks provide working code you can copy. Documentation explains concepts in depth.
